how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Producing/publishing interactive fiction;Worldbuilding (e.g. for role-playing games);Narrative fiction writing (either supporting its creation or directly writing in TiddlyWiki);Programming;Other

how do you back up/sync changes between: TiddlySpot / TiddlyHost;Git forge (GitHub, Gitea/Forgejo, GitLab);Web or cloud hosting (other than TiddlyHost/TiddlySpot e.g. Netlify, AWS, OVH, Google Cloud...);Neocities, Nekoweb, tiiny.host, omg.lol and similar services;DIY (any other solution)
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: Its high level of customization is a great aspect
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I've dabbled with Obsidian, and find myself constantly switching between TiddlyWiki and Obsidian. The one strong thing that Obsidian has that TW5 does not is the ability to easily paste images and have them be saved in a specific folder. I've been working on my own solution for that, but it's still in the works.

An autosave, if possible at all, would be great; far too many times I've had a browser crash, or something similar (or god forbid a Windows update overnight) and lost some data.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
